This camera is unbelievable. im not a professional photographer, i just needed something that took clear pictures, and i could carry around easily. this camera is perfect size. i feel like i need a full education on how to learn on the features, but the basic camera features are simply to pick up on. one thing i love about this camera is how close you can get to an object( when in the right setting) and it is crystal clear. i took a close up on a flower and couldnt believe the de ... tail it took in the stem. i could see the little pollen on the stem. highly recommend this camera! cant put it down! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: the best point and shoot out there today
Item.Review: great ergonomics, all features in the palm of your hand. awsome solution for slr photogs as a secondary portable camera. Video could have been a bit better though, no HD. Battery is somewhat weak comparing to other Canon cameras, but still gives you enough shots. Accepts all current Canon external flashes. has RAW capability.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Better than expected. Nice and compact!
Item.Review: I use this camera for shots of my family as well work(real estate). Having used a G5 for the last 5 years this camera really shows the advances Canon has made in it's powershot line. Focusing system is great, dials to control ISO and exposure compensation are super convenient. I bought this primarily for the wide focal length (28mm equivalent) without having to carry a bulky and heavy wide angle converter. Feels good in your hand albiet a bit small for my paws. Nice solid metal construction and way more compact than a G5, about half the size. Is a little on the heavy side though due to metal construction and lots of glass. Well worth the price!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Camera Wish it was Cheaper
Item.Review:
Pros: excellent photos
Cons: a bit more expensive than others
The Canon G10 is marketed as the best point and shoot camera. I have found this to be very true. It blows all my other dinky cameras out of the water. I get beautiful pictures with very little effort. There is also a bit of control over aperature and shutter speeds, etc. The camera is very small and easy to take with you when you do not want to lug around your huge digital slr on a trip or through crowds when a long lens may get in the way.
I have had one issue with the shutter, that has seemed to scratch the lens in 2 perfect vertical lines. I called customer service and they wanted me to mail in the camera to have it examined to see if it was canon's error, but I never did.
The last issue I ha ... ve with the camera is that I think it is priced too high. I could have gotten a much more advanced dslr for a few hundred more, but then I would lose out on the compactness of the G10. I would recommend this camera to any novice or professional photographer that is looking for a great point and shoot. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: My preference is SLR, but I can't tote that thing everywhere. The G10 is my take-anywhere camera. The most important thing to my workflow is shooting RAW (which the G10 can do). Also, I wanted a point-and-shoot that didn't have the manual features buried in the menus. This camera has ISO, exposure comp, shutter and aperture easily accessible! Also, I'd fallen in love with the wheel on the back of the 20D???I was thrilled to see that this was picked up with the G series. My Canon Speedlight 580EX also works with this unit (although it looks ridiculous on top of this small camera). The only problem with this camera (and every point-and-shoot) is noise. Although you have your massive 14 megapixel images, when you zoom in there is often noise in the shadows and occasionally the mid-tones (i ... n lower lighting). That being said, I think it's much better with noise than the competition and I can usually take care of the noise in post with Adobe Photoshop Lightroom. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I bought this to augment my DSLR when I don't want to carry the volume/weight of a full setup. It has proven to be a very powerful SLR replacement tool. Difficult to use some of the more advanced features and it does not feel nearly as at home in your hands as an SLR but I love the RAW capabilities.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: You don't need the manual to operate this camera. Can you believe it? It is a bit heavier and larger than those smaller pocket cameras, but you get a lot more features and better quality images than those little guys. It is a great compromise considering the great big SLRs especially when you are going on a vacation. Sometimes a great big expensive camera means steal me. At least you can put this G10 away in your purse or bag. The screen image is particularly large and it still has the eye view in case of sun glare, which smaller cameras can't have. Only downside is the plainness of the body and the elementary look of the buttons. The camera looks like it came from the 1950's. This maybe on purpose, but it looks very cheap. That maybe good for deterring the thief.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I take this camera skiing with me as well as most other places I go. It is so easy to pack in my pocket and does a wonderful job exposing my shots. I love the the 3 viewing screen. I have owned the G10 for 6 months and have left my Canon XTI behind with all the xtra lenses ever since. The G10 has as many controls as the XTI - very easy to use!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Best Camera I have ever owned
Item.Review: I used the G10 for everything from macro to panoramic pictures. This is an exceptional camera for beginners to professionals as a everyday type camera. The difference in picture quality between the G10 and the smaller point and shoot cameras it night and day. Flash is good for a small camera and the redeye does not seem to be a problem. I sold my Rebel XTi shortly after purchasing this camera as it did everything I needed it to do. Cons: Flash is a little slow for a recharge. Lag time is acceptable but a little slow

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Great camera with lots of functions??? The camera has 3 different types of manual setting. You can do Priority Aperture, Priority shutter speed as well as full manual. On top of all the different manuals setting, you are do Manual focus. Great picture quality???! Two things that I think the camera can be improved are, the Manual focus feature seems too noisy on the lcd screen, the control can also be improved. The next thing is the camera is not easy to grab on to.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Compromises that hit a sweet spot for me
Item.Review: Pros: Build Quality, Camera RAW, Control, Low ISO performance, Size ... Cons: Added megapixels, Changed kit from G9, Cost, Noise above ISO 200 Having gone through two G9's, (one stolen, its replacement, bought used, dying while on a photo vacation in Sedona) I bought the G10 without hesitation. I primarily shoot landscape at low ISO, with the camera on a tripod, and this is a brilliant bit of gear for that function. Low ISO RAW shots are on a par with heavier (and expensive) DSLRs, and the small form factor works very well for use on my motorized panorama head (Gigapan). Also the G10 improves on the G9 for HDR photos by allowing a full two stop brackets. Wouldn't have paid for the upgrade if my G9 hadn't died, as the jump from 12 megapixels to 14.5 doesn't give all that significant of an i ... mage improvement and fills cards faster in RAW format. Also my expectation that all my spare batteries and underwater casing and other G9 kit would work proved, unfortunately, false. But that said, this is still a fine prosumer compromise between a less flexible point and shoot and a DSLR. And I'm not tempted to get into buying a range of lenses. The build quality is very solid, consistent with the high end pro cameras, and it will be interesting to see if the death of the G9 was a fluke. I'm hoping that's the case. As for whether I would recommend to a friend, that would be purpose driven. If they need the prosumer pluses, then totally yes, but as a simple point and shoot, I would steer folks to a cheaper option. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: A good working camera in overalls
Item.Review: The G10 would be better without so many functions requiring the LED screen which is almost impossible to see in bright sunlight. It would do far better with more analogue dial-up functions and fewer things on the over-cluttered LED screen. The way it is, it takes far too long to set up a single shot. The ring around the set button is small for my fingers. I suppose a small machine will have to have small buttons, so why complain; bigger buttons would only mean a bigger and heavier camera. Compromise!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I have been shooting Wedding photography and low-light music events for a number of years and have been utilizing the Canon 5D with great success. For my needs as a backup and for size considerations I purchased the G-10 - in spite of negative remarks regarding high ISO and low image quality. My belief is that the shooter in the digital world must also be able to pull out the stops in post-production with whatever software is used. After using the G-10 in low-light music concert situations and in general use I find that the camera excels. The low-light issues I read about did not present problems and the image results were nothing less than spectacular. The features, including the video capabilities make this camera a valuable asset to my photo work. It's ease of use and the pro features ... make it a reasonably priced back up camera - that I have used as a primary piece of equipment! Now, on to the 5D Mark II . . . expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Picture Quality; Easy Setup; Comfortable Controls; Bright LCD; Strong Construction
Most reviews here are favourable and I wholeheartedly agree. My two disappointments are the optical viewfinder which is tiny, inaccurate, and consequently next to useless. I don’t always want to take pictures at arm’s length, even though the rear screen is first-class. Sometimes I want to shoot Leica style using the optical viewfinder. If you’re like me then, the G10, just like the preceding G7 and G9, in this area will disappoint.
Secondly, only Photoshop CS4 will open the G10s RAW files. Having paid a small fortune for CS3 – a wonderful piece of software what does all and more than I want it to – I REALLY don’t want to shell out again for the update. At the time of writing this ... in February 2009, the word on the web is that Adobe have no plans to release a plug-in for CS3 to recognise my lovely G10 RAW files. So be warned – budget as well to further line Adobe’s pockets.
One further problem to overcome...this camera does not easily lend itself to the use of filters. That extending lens and 28mm wide-angle make finding a workable filter system difficult. My solution is a Lensmate G10 58mm adapter and a 58mm extension tube. Together or singly they allow a Cokin filter holder to be used at all focal lengths. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: G10 excellent, but Mac users take note.
Item.Review: I am a confirmed digital Canon customer having owned a 640 and a G7 before this model. The G10 is new, my experience is with the G7, but I expect the the G10 to hold to the same, or better standards as it is quite similar. I used (and sometimes abused) the G7 for ethnographic field work and it held up remarkably well. I make frequent use of the flash shoe with a canon flash with excellent results. I note that some other makes offer this now. But this is still the only camera in its category to make sound recordings, as well as video clips, both of which I also find very useful. For my purposes the battery life is quite adequate although I generally carry two spares. I very rarely use the second spare and think I'll go without it on the new model. Unfortunately Canon has decided to go with ... a bigger battery this model, probably to power the bigger view screen. I would have been quite happy with the old set-up. [...] MAC USERS BEWARE. The camera's programs require OS10.4 or higher, NOT the advertised OS9 and above. the Canon site is also confusing on this point. Overall excellent camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I have used the Canon Gs for many years and the new Canon G10 is the best small P&S digital camera ever. This small Canon can do a lot in getting you quality colorful pictures. It's fast starting with a large easy to view screen. It's a strong build with easy to use controls. It's new larger battery give a longer life span then the older Gs. I really like my new Canon G10 and you will also.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: more than a point and shoot
Item.Review: to be fair, i haven't used this camera near enough to claim any expertise and i'm definitely a beginner photog, so bare that in mind: i'm still working my way thru the manual on this thing. so far the pics look good, but too much grain in low light. the controls are not intuitive and are hard to manuever for big hands like mine. still, it's jam-packed with features (and megapixels). and it's very rugged and easy to carry around when you don't want to deal with changing lenses. the battery life is very good.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: G10 Rated a ten in my book
Item.Review:
Pros: Great price for pic quality you get. rugged design. Great display.
Cons: Strap is kind of on the cheap side, but it works good for what it is. Screen is nice and big, but easily scratched or smudged prints on it. Need to provide protective covers or stickers for the screen. I had to buy it on ebay.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to Keep Clean; Strong Construction; Comfortable Controls; Easy Setup; Easy To Use; Great Picture Quality; Bright LCD
Cons: Long Lag Time
I have used the Canon G10 now for the last 3 weeks on vacation. The picture quality, lens, controls, LCD screen, overall quality and control are excellent. This camera is for the Enthusiast or semi pro who does not want to carry a 35mm size camera but wants top quality and and manual and automatic control.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use; Easy to Keep Clean; Bright LCD; Great Picture Quality; Comfortable Controls; Strong Construction; Easy Setup
Cons: Mode Switch Location
This camera can turn even the novice into a pro. Chocked full of user friendly features that allow the photographer to custom taylor their needs. Super Sharp 3" LCD display. RAW file format along with JPEG simultaneously. Super crisp images, that can be put to super size prints without losing essential definition (14.7 MP to the rescue).
The only drawback to the package is the mode switch is located on top of the ISO dial which can lead to accidental change in ISO when changing the mode dial.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy Setup; Bright LCD; Great Picture Quality; Easy To Use
Cons: Short Battery Life
I researched this camera long before I decided to purchase. All the feature are great and easy to use. The Canon will provide me the class of picture that I demand. [...]

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: The G10 is a sweet little piece of gear
Item.Review: I love the handling, controls and the overall feel of this camera. The G10 is very sturdy camera. Things I love about the G10: Feel, controls, bright light shots, macro, landscape and flash portraits indoors. The G10 weighs next to nothing in comparison to the DSLR's. You will have a lot of creative control but this isn't a DSLR replacement camera. Things I wish Canon would have improved: I would have liked to have had HD video along with better noise control at ISO's at 400 and above. I really would have liked to have had the lens length of the G9 with the wide-angle lens capability of the G10. That would have made the decision a no brainer. Personally, I almost returned the G10. I was disatisfied with it's low light, no flash shots. Then I just had to look at it and say, It's ... not a DSLR...it's an excellent point and shoot camera. I do believe the G10 is the most controllable, best handling camera in the Advanced Point and Shoot category. I have seen some G10 shots online and can only say that just about everything is attainable with this little camera. It just depends on your willingless to accept it isn't a DSLR. Overall recommendation - Keep it. I am keeping mine. Once I realized I was asking a bit much from this little guy....I cut him some slack and have been much happier every since. Looking at the pics on-line from the G10, I can say I have some learning to do. This camera is capable and I'm just learning how to make it work for me. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Bright LCD; Great Picture Quality; Comfortable Controls; Easy To Use; Strong Construction
Not on par with an SLR, but an excellent point and shoot. A little bulky at first, but I soon got used to it. The images came out bright and clear. Great choice for somebody not willing to lug around a lot of camera gear. The battery life was good and the stabilizer works great. Focusing is fast and accurate even in low light. And I just love the big clear LCD.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Camera for this amazing price
Item.Review: I like the super big lcd although the strong point is shooting in bright ambient because high iso is too noisy. this is a ccd not a cmos chip. flash definitely helps in low light. this version took away the time lapse feature which disappointed me. the wider lens is a good factor and so is the quick +/- dial. slightly bulky but a serious camera cannot be too small.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I'm a professional photojournalist who travels regularly on assignment and this is the camera I ALWAYS have with me, especially when I'm done working and I go out for dinner or drinks. This is probably my 6th Canon G camera and it's the best so far. I just sold my G9 about a month ago. The time from power on to shoot is the shortest ever, not a DSLR but pretty darn fast. Image quality is great up to iso200 and good up to iso400. From there on, you'd need some kind of noise reduction software but in jam iso800 would do. No it doesn't shoot HD video but then again, I bought a still camera, if I wanted HD video I woulda bought a vid cam that shot stills...

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: GREAT CAMERA - GREAT FEEL AND FLEXIBITY
Item.Review: I've had many digital cameras after migrating from film. All were like toys, a few got close to giving me what I wanted, a camera that handled and shot like a 35mm rangefinder. One that had feel and weight with great optics. Well, this is the one. Flexibility that allows me to shoot, no create pictures with all the adjustments I could want or shoot auto to grab that quick snapshot with no lag! And B&H is best place to buy it!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera to take on trips.
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy Setup; Comfortable Controls; Bright LCD; Great Picture Quality; Easy to Keep Clean; Easy To Use
Great camera. Would be nice to have a way to keep a filter attached and keep it small. Extremely versitle.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Best of the G's yet-Best Digi Around
Item.Review: I've had quite a few digital cameras since they first were offered. Most were either Canon or Nikon but there has been a sampling of Sony, Casio and Panasonic. They have been 3x to 12x, one megapixel to 10. And as an old 35mm photog I thought I would never find a camera to satisfy my craving for a rangefinder camera with lots of manual adjustments. Don't misunderstand, point and shoots are quick, easy and grab those quick document shots, but to explore the reaches of creativity an adjustable camera is necessary. Digi-slr are great but still heavy and are more difficult to grab that never to get shot. The G-10 has solved my craving. It can be used in auto for those quick shots and has all of the adjustability to create a picture. Making pictures instead of taking pictures. The opti ... cs are superb, lag between pictures, quick enough to feel like a 35mm camera. The zoom range is adequate enough and the picture quality is just wonderful. So to say it simply, I am in love! It is the best all around camera I have ever owned. Yes, it is a little heavier than other digitals but the weight is worth the other advantages and it feels like a camera should-stable. I have just commenced on a self-assignment (suggested by my son)to create photos of my Staten Island. Over the years some of my photos have received acclaim for capturing the emotion of inadament scenes around my island home. The G is deffinately suited for that assignment as well as my ungoing one of cataloguing my grandkids as they grow older. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Good Things Come in Small Packages
Item.Review: I bought the G10 after I brought my S60 out of retirement for an afternoon party at a friend's house, and it became obvious from the pictures that there have been improvements in technology since the last time I used it. The G10 won't fit in your shirt pocket, but since I carry a purse, and it fits nicely inside that, I'm fine with its size. Under almost all conditions it takes beautifully sharp and clear shots. It's perfect for taking travel and family photos. My main gripe is the shutter lag and the slow burst mode. I'm spoiled by my 40D. I've gotten interested in street photography, and the G10 disappoints me in this area. On the other hand, for things like landscapes, seascapes, sunrises, groups of friends, etc. it really delivers.Another gripe I have is the size of its files. ... I shoot RAW, and I only get about 200 shots on a 4 gig card. My computer (about a year old) takes its own sweet time about downloading and processing G10 files. Also, at this writing (11/20/08), CS3 Camera Raw doesn't recognize the G10. The software that comes with the camera is OK, but it's not Photoshop. Having said all that, I'm very happy with my purchase. The quality of the shots are just as good as those of my 40D, and it's a lot lighter to haul around. If only they could speed up the shutter response. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: No need to drag around my 5D anymore!!!
Item.Review: The raw feature on this camera make professional life a breeze. I can take this around and use it for small magazine quality photos and beautiful personal images. the body is strong and handsome. It can replace all my other cameras on most fun outings. And if there were a shot that I could use for work, well, the RAW setting would allow me to use it for that too! Its so versatile, I just love it.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: What a Lot in a Small Package
Item.Review:
Pros: So many pixals, shoots RAW, fun shooting modes
Cons: Almost too small
I can't believe Canon has packed so much in this camera. It's like the "big boys" without carrying all the lenses. Could possibly use more telephoto, but there is a lot to offer at this price point.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Good for enhancing detail at distance
Item.Review: I use this on my Canon G-10 to bring the far photos a little closer and enhance the detail on them. It is not going to extend your range by much on the telephoto end of the G-10, but the pictures will be much clearer, allowing you to resize and crop for that zoomed-in look. It works best in bright light, but you will have to stop it down so the bright areas of your picture don't blow out. For the super crystal clear shots, I use a monopod or tripod, but handheld still works pretty well. The down side to this lens is that you get serious vinetting when you zoom in with the lens still attached, so you can't just leave it on the camera full-time. That's a shame, because it is handy for the long shots. It seems to be solidly built, but the weight doesn't really affect the balance of th ... e G-10. For what I bought it for (extending the G-10 telephoto range a little, and making those far shots a little clearer so you can enlarge and crop later, it is worth the money I spent. I'm happy with it. It could have gotten 5 stars if it had threads for filters, but it doesn't so no filters. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: The macro lens is very sharp! This is however the only use I have had with this bundle. When using the Wide lens for wide shots th image gets cut in all corners so you get a tube shot... not very nice. G12

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Pros: Easy to Use, Fast Shutter Speed, Fast start up, Good Battery Life, Good sized screen, Great Resolution, Great Zoom, Nice Features and Settings A friend recommended the G10 to me. I have a couple of cheaper digital cameras and they do not perform to my expectation. The G10 takes great pictures and is easy to use. The only issue is close-up shots. It is hard to focus. It take a little experimenting with to get it down. Well worth the money for the features and quality.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great compromise between compact and SLR
Item.Review: Pros: Compact for pants pocket, Excellent in Low Light, Fast Shutter Speed, Good Battery Life, Good sized screen, Great Resolution, Great Zoom, Nice Features and Settings ... Cons: Complicated Controls When the time came to replace our SD400 due to inadvertent water damage, the difficult choice was between a compact camera and an SLR. We definitely wanted to be able to take better pictures than with a pocket-size camera, after regretting that we took our old SD 400 on a safari. However, we still wanted a camera that can easily be schlepped around to hiking and climbing trips, as every pound counts. We finally decided on the G10 as a compromise and so far we have not been disappointed. The case is sturdy and protects the camera on our trips. It's multitude of settings gives almost SLR-like ... capabilities. The only downside I would see is that if you really want to use those nifty features, they are likely a bit more difficult to use than with an SLR. Having said that, I have taken pretty decent night pictures with this camera and some trying and tweaking, and have used maybe a third or half of the camera features here and there. Except for those special scenes and occasions, however, I just use the automatic mode. The 5x zoom might not be as strong as other hi-zoom cameras. However, those are typically larger (see introduction). If I needed a higher zoom factor, I just shoot in highest-resolution and crop the image later (my default setting is 5MP anyway). Picture quality is great from all I can tell. Reaction time (shutter lag?) is excellent, especially when you prime the camera by pressing the release button down halfway. All in all, I am very happy with this camera and recommend it to people who need better quality than pocket cameras can offer but who don't want to spend $800+ or need a more compact camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Pros: Easy to Use, Excellent in Low Light, Fast Shutter Speed, Good sized screen, Great Resolution, Great Zoom, Nice Features and Settings ... Cons: Grip I have experienced NO shutter at start up or on the fly with this camera. The zoom and auto focus features are fool proof. The integrity of the shot in low lite or sunlite is superb. The fall colours I'm capturing with this camera are excellent. I'm still getting used to my new acquistion but so far so GOOD.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to Keep Clean; Strong Construction; Great Picture Quality; Comfortable Controls; Bright LCD; Easy To Use; Easy Setup
Carry it in my pocketbook... Love that I can use it easily as a "point and shoot" or can manually adjust

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: As close to a digital SLR as you can get
Item.Review: Pros: Easy to Use, Excellent in Low Light, Fast Shutter Speed, Good Battery Life, Good sized screen, Great Resolution, Nice Features and Settings I take a lot of nature shots outdoors. The color is great and the pictures always come out excellent. I especially enjoy the macro lens. Great shots of plants and insects close up.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Raw files. This is big for me as a stock shooter. Easy to change ASA settings. Easy to change exposure and see the effects. Not menu driven. Real knobs that turn and give you what you want. A very professional camera in a small footprint

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Picture Quality; Easy Setup; Comfortable Controls; Bright LCD
The G10 was highly recommended by a Semi-pro photographer friend. We are glad we listened. Very worth every cent.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: The best point and shoot around
Item.Review: I have a G9 and love it so I ordered the G10, I'm a professional photographer and always have a camera on me and hate lugging the SLR all the time. The Gs have it all, quality,construction and size. Con- I would like it to be compatible with canons Digital Photo Professional software.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I carry this camera everywhere. Whats good about the camera is the quality of the pictures, quick shutter. It has the features of a 35mm camera. the only problem with the camera is the size. it's a little big but I still wear it on my hip.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Clear pictures, good learning camera
Cons: Price
Great camera! i had a sony touch screen before this one a buddy recommended it he didnt buy it but i took his word for it and i love it. it never leaves my side. the pictures are clear.. and all the photo editing buttons and out side of the camera so its easy and you can put another flash on it for better pictures

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: The images are blurred and I don't think the IS is working. Took it to Canon Service Center and they replaced the lens element and said they brought it to factory specs. The image jumps around on the LCD, so much for IS. Nothing like my Sony. I bought a kit for B&H for over $600 dollars. Will probably give it to my grandkids.I used to love Canon, but this has put a sour taste in my mouth.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great balance of size and image quality
Item.Review: Great for street and close up photography. Excellent light backup for my DSLR. Image quality exceeded my expectations after reading about noise at ISO settings above 100. I have excellent results with ISO 200 and 400 and very usable images above that. I use Av mode and have easy access to the controls that I need: Zoom, Aperture, Exposure Compensation, and ISO. Other important controls (flash, closeup, focus area shift) require one additional click to select the control. The main problem is the relatively-long time between shots, so it's not a camera for action photography. As with most small cameras, it's hard to separate the subject from the background with a shallow depth of field.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I was considering a SLR. I have friends that are professional photographers. They raved about this and told me that I can still point and shoot while learning what i might do with an SLR. It will give me a chance to figure out if I really am going to be a decent photographer. The color is fantastic. The options for various modes have been excellent and helped me take good photos. The opportunity to override aperture and shutter speed has made for some fun learning. Once I own it a bit longer, there are flashes and a telephoto lens that I can purchase.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Fantastic Camera, especially for the hobbyist.
Item.Review:
Pros: Exceptionally clear shots, macro pictures
Cons: Hefty price tag
I was looking around for awhile for a good camera for a starting block into photography. I originally thought I was going to get the Nikon P90 because of its big MP and 24x zoom, but after I saw a side by side comparison with this G10, I was amazed. The amount of clarity and detail in pictures is great, and you wont get bored messing with all the different settings and adjustments possible. Another draw to this camera for me was the options to add on with accessories. Aftermarket lens (telephoto and wide angle) packages can be had on ebay for under $150; that will be my next investment. Overall I'm happy with my investment!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Strong Construction; Great Picture Quality; Easy to Keep Clean; Comfortable Controls; Easy To Use; Bright LCD
Cons: Long Lag Time
Great for nature and family photos. Macro is superb. I shoot mostly in RAW format so lag between shots is a problem even with a fast card. There are so many options that I would NOT recommend it for beginners. I have been shooting constantly for three weeks and have not been through all of the shooting modes. Money was well spent. I also ordered the 58MM lens adapter which is a must have item.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Canon g10; A great alternative to your SLR!
Item.Review:
Pros: excellent photos; rugged construction; raw file type
Canon g10; A great alternative to your SLR!
I normal take my Canon T1i SLR on trips for taking photos and the one off video. However, there are times when I cant carry the SLR around. I have found that the Canon G10 is a great alternative for taking photos in these type of situations.
It has its similarities to the SLR and then its differences. Obviously unlike an SLR you cannot change out lenses but the built in lens has enough zoom range to take some great shots and not leave you wanting an additional lens.
The construction of the camera is tough enough and the availability of a hotshoe for an external flash make it conducive for taking photos in low light.
It also has photo recording in RAW for ... mat so if you like to do editing work, it helps.
All in all we have been very happy with this purchase! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: If you are shooting in a fairly dark area and you've set auto ISO and expect the camera to set a high enough ISO to take a pic, it won't do it. The ISO jumps to 200 and the red camera on the display flashes, which tells you the shutter speed is so low you'll probably get movement in the shot. The Canon engineers were aware that shooting at Higher ISO numbers will introduce excessive noise, they fixed it so you have to manually set a higher ISO and accept the results.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, incredible pics
Cons: nothing
I wanted an slr camera but didn't want to deal with the size and I wanted something my wife could easily use. I was sick of the picture quality of most compact cameras. This thing is perfect for us and the picture quality is as good as some slrs I've seen. It's a bit pricey but worth every penny, we've taken some amazing shots already. Another great thing is how fast it is, hit the power button and it's ready to go. I think i'm a canon fan for life.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: good picture quality, LCD good size
Cons: nothing
The quality of pictures this camera captures is amazing. Very nice lighting and settings. You just have to fool around with it and learn. It takes time but once you get used to it, you'll love it even more. It has a great LCD size as well.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: It handles like a Retina IIa with a zoom lens, 800 asa color and instant review gratification. What's not to like? As a snap-shot tourist, I like that its lighter and less likely to attract attention than my SLR. Lacks the low level light capability of my SLR, but available light at ASA 800 with it isn't any worse than pushed 35 mm film. I haven't actually printed anything yet, so I may get a surprise, but it does look good blown up in photoshop, and certainly viewed on the computer. The camera does have image stablization, and the Leica IIIf everybody wants to compare it to sure didn't. On the whole, a nice piece of glass.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Picture Quality; Easy Setup; Easy To Use; Strong Construction; Comfortable Controls; Easy to Keep Clean; Bright LCD
Cons: A bit heavy
I had been using both a Canon film SLR camera and a smaller digital point and shoot Camera for many years. The Canon G10 has replaced both. It is just slightly larger than the point and shoot, yet it has all the functions of my film SLR. Like the SLR, it's very well built and actually many of the SLR accessories (flash, remote, etc...) can be used with the G10. Picture quality is amazing even in low light. Colors are rich, pictures are sharp, noise is low. Pictures look extremely realistic with good depth. The LCD screen is large and bright. Battery life is much better than expected. Overall, I think this is a great camera.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Excellent, really well built and takes fantastic pictures. Easy to use in auto but enough features to let you take complete control if you want to. A perfect camera if you want something better than point-and-shoot but don't want to go the whole way to DSLR

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: jury is still out on this one...
Item.Review: Well I puchased this item thinking it would enhance photos I was after with my kids soccer and triathlon events I attend. Have to say I am no professional when it comes to taking photos but it just seems as if this lense really makes the photos grainy and am still working through this. I havent given up but I really thought this would be an easy add on to use. I will say it does add a few more feet to capturing photos at a distance. I dont like the adapter and find it almost a hender. I wish Cannon would have made it one piece considering they dont do any other lenses for the g10. Rather you have to purchase the adapter and the lense to make this work. As well, I wish they provided a hard case to slip the factory installed g10 lense when using this adapter and tele lense. All you get is ... a small bag. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: great p&s, a portable backup camera
Item.Review: i use this as my always-carry-with-me camera, as well as location backup-camera-in-case-everything-goes-wrong. ergonomics is well-thought, menus are self-explanatory 90% of the time (10% would be the time i accidentally turned my on-camera flash off permanently¬ being able to reverse it yet). it feels good in hand, buttons are the right size for my medium-sized hands. plenty of dedicated buttons, ev adjustment knob is extremely helpful. lcd is great, bright, crisp & big. it can easily be used with off-camera flash via a cord(or on-camera with no cord, if you really wish so), and can save the day for an assignment. really. lens get fairly wide(better than g9), and covers a pretty good range. low-light performance is pretty bad, i try not to go over 400 iso at all. though this is ... expected, as it is still a point&shoot camera, with the same guts of a smaller canon sd...as such, don't expect too much if you intend to shoot moving subjects (i.e. your newborn or your puppy) with no flash. but here, it shines from the point&shoots, because of the hot-shoe socket on the top: if you don't mind the extra weight, pop an external flash in there and you're golden. one pet peeve of mine is the fact that i haven't been able to find a tight-fitting sleeve for it: most are either too small or too bulky. so i carry it naked, which does make conscious of the camera at all times, a negative for me. it replaced my tiny canon ex for me, added much more flexibility, a bit of bulk(that i don't mind), and no extra low-light capability. if you are looking for a pocket camera, this is not it. i'd get an sd-xxx if that's the case. if you are looking for a solution that will enable you to leave the dslr at home on casual trips and you want to get a little involved with your snaps, this is it; with a bonus of doubling as a occasionally used backup camera to your dslr, that also has video capabilities for casual occasions. my d700 is mostly at home now, for those times i mentioned above, and assignments. when i think i may get a little more serious, i grab my d40x. overall, i am a happy camper. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable Controls; Strong Construction; Great Picture Quality
Cons: 300 page instruction book
Needed a camera for vacation. I was very pleased about the quality of the pictures and the ease of downloading them to my computer. One plug in and I was printing pictures!!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: These items are all of poor quality. The web site said the manufacturer is Canon but that is not the case. Little if no effect when the lens were installed. Waste of money

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I use this camera for travel, fun and anytime I do not want to carry one of my dslr bodies. This camera has great IQ up to ISO 400 and acceptable up to 1600 and a useful and quality zoom of approx 28-140. I was amazed at the quality of images and very pleased with the build. There are many dslr features on this camera or you can use it like any other p&s. I would rec a hotshoe flash like the Canon 270 or even larger if you prefer. I have used the 270 which is great for 90% of flash photography and also one of my 580s with great results. Great little camera! Get one and enjoy.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: A great camera -- except in low light
Item.Review: I have three other Canon cameras: a 30D, a 50D and a 5D Mark II, and I bought this camera to have something I could carry easily in my pocket. The G10 is well-built, flexible, and has a good lens. It should be top-flight point-and-shoot. However, it takes great pictures at ISO 80 or 100 but digital noise begins to become noticeable even at ISO 200. The 25.3 Mpx/cm2 pixel density of its small sensor is the problem. I wish Canon had resisted the marketing appeal of more megapixels and instead concentrated on image quality at higher ISOs so that this camera would be more useful in low-light situations. I had also hoped to use the G-10 (and the LA-DC58K lens adapter) for digiscoping with a Swarovski scope but discovered that it would not work because of severe vignetting when coupled to the sc ... ope. Eventually I decided to return the camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Strong Construction; Easy To Use; Easy Setup; Comfortable Controls; Bright LCD; Great Picture Quality
Cons: None yet
Wife was megapixal deprivied. This camera solved the problem

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This is a great little package! I am coming from a 5D and 24-70L, so wasn't expecting full-frame pro-glass IQ, but have been very impressed. I think the most impressive aspect is just how versatile this camera is. I travel a LOT and this is so much easier to carry than my 5D, and gives me pictures I wouldn't get with my 5D, because I'd never take the 5D out in as many on the fly situations. So, that in itself is worth it, just because I'm getting more shots now. Image quality is fantastic if you can keep the ISO down. Features are great, but take a little getting used to (can't be as quick with them as you can on a DSLR in most cases). Love the fact that it can be used manually, and even works with my speedlights. Video is such a nice feature to have, and so easy to use. Would lov ... e HD video, but this does the trick, and has great quality (just don't zoom in while shooting video because the quality really degrades a ton - but that's pretty typical). Overall a fantastic little package for getting great shots, remaining stealth, and still enjoying the true aspects of photography. Not an SLR, but it's not supposed to be...which is also why I bought it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Strong Construction; Bright LCD; Easy To Use; Great Picture Quality
The ergonomics could be better. Holding the camera can feel somewhat awkward, and it takes 2 hands to do nearly everything. I am going to fix this problem by purchasing lens attachement accessories from lensmate... Then I will have more to hold on to.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Great little camera, now I don't have to lug my 1D MKII around, but I still will at times. The macro on this thing is incredible, you can set the lens right on top of your subject. It even shoots pretty good video. The display on the LCD is awesome, nice and bright. Still has the shutter lag that I really don't like and I make fun of when I'm using my 1D.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: i want to have its babies
Item.Review: I am in absolute love with my g10 and try to convince anyone in the market its the best purchase they'll ever make. I've already converted two of my photography friends and they love me for it. I bought this camera after hearing rave reviews from a friend who owns a g9. I thought why not give it a try. I was going on a ten day trip to Paris and didn't really want to lug around my 5d. It was deff. the right choice and will be used from now on when I travel. The great perks (which I could seriously go on and on about each one for hours) about the g10 is the 14.7 mega pixels, large view moniter, amazing video capture, I'm able to change ISO/exposure compensation in a flash and it offers everything my 5d has but without the bulk and lens worry. The lens on the g10 is great too with some of the ... best zoom I've seen yet. I also like how the settings I use the most are on the top of the camera like that of an old slr. Plus you don't have to keep going into your menu to change your settings. Also another cool feature is you can dial down your flash exposure if needed. Even at 1600 ISO it still performs at its best with little noise. The g10 is like old world charm with new world technology. Plus you can purchase underwater housing for it for less than $200 bucks!Canon really out did themselves this time around. I've owned a lot of snapshot cameras in the past but this one takes the cake. It is a great travel companion because its not intimidating like a big SLR, but it still looks like a professional camera. This G10 is for sure my 007 of cameras. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Comfortable Controls; Great Picture Quality; Bright LCD
I love this camera. I carry it with me wherever I go. I have both a Canon 20D and Elph and this is the perfect blend of both.
I especially love the size. Small enough to carry everywhere but big enough to feel substantial. Reminds me of a Leica CL.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I replaced my Nikon D40 with a Canon G9 and loved the capabilities it offered. Now, I didn't need separate lenses to carry along or a bulky DSLR body while I traveled. BUT, I still retained my full manual control, exposure bracketing, RAW, etc. I do lots of landscapes while traveling, so I needed to go wider - the G10 offered that and more, with a bigger battery, better grip, and the awesome exposure control dial! Anything above ISO80 can get scketchy, but at 80, it's awesome. IS is key when you are without a tripod or anything else to brace the camera on. Even the video quality is good - better than the Flip Video camera at times, but nice to have. Haven't used the flash - wouldn't recommend it anyway. This is the perfect camera for the photo enthusiast who needs something more ... compact for travel. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I took this camera on a recent trip to Cambodia and it has been terrific. I am far from a professional photographer but got a lot of incredible shots, using all kinds of settings. I really like the easy accessibility of the settings, so that, even as an amateur, I can play with the different modes to find the best shots. I didn't think the extra megapixels would make a big difference but I took some photos while on a boat trip and when I zoomed in was able to see all kinds of details that I hadn't even noticed before. And they were still clear. I liked being able to edit size (and red eye) on the camera itself as I was sharing my images with friends along the way. At this point, I only have points to make in favor of this. I also ran into a crew making a documentary who asked to check ... out my G10 as they were hoping to get one for themselves. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: This is my first digital camera. I only shot film prior. I have been back and forth about switching to digital but was tired of carrying around an slr. The G9 caught my attention and the G10 put me over the edge. Great manual controls in easy locations to maneuver. Very bright viewing screen. And there is virtually no lag time when you press the shutter like most digital cameras have. Even when using flash. Absolutely the best camera if you want digital but don't want to lug an slr around.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Great things come in small packages...
Item.Review: I use this camera for business and pleasure and find it able to perform over and above needed duties. The photos are freakishly clear and the colors seem to jump out at you. My only gripe is that the movie mode is not HD. I would buy this camera again and recommend it to anyone.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I bought this camera for underwater use in an Ikelite Housing. I own a Nikon D200 and Ikelite housing but you are limited by the lens you use underwater. No current zoom lenses for the Nikon have this zoom range PLUS THE MACRO CAPABILITIES, and fit the Ikelite ports. After using the camera topside for the past 3 weeks alongside my Nikon D200 I must say I am very impressed with this little camera!!! It understandably exhibits more noise than the Nikon, but if you shoot RAW and remove the noise you can get remarkably close to the Nikon. If you are looking for more features and better image quality than most of the small cheaper cameras, this might just be your camera. Having the dedicated exposure compensation wheel on top of the camera is a real PLUS. Note that this camera does NOT h ... ave a BULB setting (shame on you Canon.) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: About the only thing I found flaw with this camera is the images it produced. It just happened to be the most important thing. Canon has built the best looking, most functional (all most useful buttons are in the right places), best feels, which is the case of this camera. But the images are way below expectation. I must have a bad copy of this camera, because I just flat did not get the image quality I was looking for, did not matter how much I tweaked it. I shot it with default setting, auto and custom WB, exposure adjustment, auto and custom ISO, Av, Tv mode, every setting known to man. I could say that its images are worse than those I took with my old Canon A620. Very soft and noise is visible in any ISO speed. Long lag time and long shot to shot time. I used a Sandisk Extreme III SD ... card, and it was still slow! Everyone who has this camera loved it. I loved it too. I would try to live with some of its faults, if not for the low quality of images it produced. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: The camera that made me choose ovr Nikon
Item.Review: What an awesome camera!!!!!!! I'm a long time pro Nikon Shooter and was so tired of dragging many pounds of equipment with me on vacations. But quality absolutely had to be there for me to leave my SLR's at home. Since I don't shoot sports on vacations a compact camera seemed the way to go. Compact cameras like this do have a shutter lag(time it takes to actually take the picture after the release button is pushed)...this can be a problem for fast moving subjects but with some practice most other types of photography can be done very successfully. I was tempted to go with the Nikon P6000 till I saw the test image results, and I was sold on the Canon G10. One of the main things I needed the camera to do is be self sufficient..meaning... no extra lenses and accessories. The 28mm wide angl ... e is BEAUTIFUL and finally what I needed to convert me over to a compact camera, and it has an oustanding macro capability too...Oh so convenient. Then I found out that the optical zoom has a special in-camera cropping feature that can zoom to: 140mm at 15 megapixel (16x24 at 200dpi), 180mm at 9 megapixel (12x17 at 200dpi) or 238mm at 5 megpixel (8x10 at 200dpi)... AMAZING...who needs that cumbersome and expensive add on teleconverter when the camera can do it optically in camera just by reducing the megapixels some. I also love the rugged feel and quality of this camera and it's not so small that I can't hold it comfortably. Controls just like the pro SLR's. Then there is more...the super sharp and clear 3 inch monitor has finally switched me over from looking thru viewfinders. The flash is just powerfull enough for most general shooting needs especially since I tend to use flash more for Fill ...using ambient light for the main exposure. The results are simply STUNNING. Then if all that wasn't enough..this camera can also do movies up to One Hour or 4 Gig whichever comes first...How in the world did they pack all of this in this fanastic camera. What more can I say but ABSOLUTELY AMAZING... I love it so much that I just purchased another Canon G10. Congratulations Canon...you have a winner. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Pictue quality, features, battery life
Cons: price
I bought this camera during the after Christmas sales last year. I am very happy with it so far. I have been needing a new camera for a long time. I needed something to take everyday pictures with and then something to take precise reference images for CG modeling, and textures. It took me about a week to fully understand every feature and setting on the camera. All this is an amazing camera, I wouldn't buy this camera unless you have a need for the settings it provides. For everyday picture taking I would suggest the Canon Powershot SD990 IS, this camera has the same quality pictures without all the complex settings.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Takes fantastic photos. Easy to use, light weight, many options for special effects. Has RAW image mode, so it's great for Photo Shop.
I wanted a camera that would take great photos and have many options for special effects, etc., but did not want a big, heavy and expensive SLR again. This camera offers all the features of an SLR, but without the weight and price. I LOVE it!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I was less than happy with this lens. I ended up returning it and buying a Raynox DCR-1541PRO. The Raynox has 67mm filter threads in front, the TC-DC58D does not. Plus the Raynox is a 1.54x vs. Canon's 1.4x. The glass is not bad and it works just fine there are just better options.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Pros: Easy To Use, Good Image Quality, Good Image Stabilization, Great Zoom Excellent camera. Tough body, well made. Not a basic point and shoot, so a good choice between one and a DSLR.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Amazing camera! I basically bought it to learn. It's easy to use, the menu is great, easy to change settings...Another reason why I chose this camera was color, and I am very happy with the results. It's also quite small and easy to carry around.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: There are so many things to shoot in New York City and having this camera is great. You can carry it around and functions are similar to DSLR and very comparable to low end DSLRs. I take pictures of just about everything and I use this a lot with my photo clubs photo trips. I dont have much things against this camera except that I needed to learn how to use the dial quickly. I also wish that the low light functions but other than that, it's a great camera. This is probably the best point and shoot digital camera I ever used.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Pros: High Quality ... Cons: Expensive I have found this camera to be rewarding and frustrating. I bought it because I wanted the manual abilities, and I wanted a camera that would give stellar image quality without the bulk of an SLR to haul around. It works okay for snapshots with friends and such, but really isn't ideal for night-out quick snapshots like other cameras are. Its autofocus button is sensitive and hard to get used to, you will end up having it take the picture annoyingly when you were jut trying to autofocus. The controls are cool, I like the design, and its comfortable to use for prolonged periods. Overall, if I had it to do over again I'd buy an SLR, and just cough up the money and then buy a cheapie camera for snapshots. This camera will give you excellent images in its ... category, but ultimately you will be frustrated because its just not up to the standards of an SLR. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: As a amateur photographer back in the day, I put out pretty decent black and white work in my home dark room, using my Nikon FTN. So, I have some knowledge of aperture, shutter speed, etc. In choosing my next digital, I wanted something with more manual control like I had then, especially focus.I figured I'll get a state of the art SLR when I retire. For now, I wanted something close to an SLR. So far, I love this camera. If you have the patience, you can mimic an SLR with the G10. Takes great pictures. The only drawbacks are, that with a boxers' hands, the little focusing ring and buttons are a bit tough to manage, but that's just me. It also is a bit large for a point and shoot. You're not slipping this baby into your shirt pocket or the inside pocket of a sport coat unless you want to l ... ook like you're packing. So, even though the G10is a no brainer in automatic mode, I may get a low end elph just so my wife doesn't murder me when we go to a wedding or some occasion and I tell her to put the G10 in her purse. All in all, having done some research and huddling up with the knowledgable counter guys at B&H....the G10 is the one you want... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I use it as a third camera and carry it with me in my pocket or in the car. It has great resolution and I can use the program mode or Manual, AV or TV modes as I desire. It gives me the flexibility I want in a point & shoot.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I was looking for a camera that was small enough to take almost anywhere but had the features and image quality of a DSLR, and I think I found it in the G10. A key for me was having a wide-angle lens, and although the 28mm (35mm equivalent) isn't huge-wide, it's wide enough for me to shoot in fairly tight quarters. I know that megapixels aren't everything, but combined with the brilliant lens and a very high level of control for a compact, the shots are great. The only thing--and I'm learning how to avoid this--is that its a bit tricky to grip the camera without covering the AF assist beam or the flash. The thing is so packed full of features that there's not much surface for your hands.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Exactly what I was looking for
Item.Review: I wanted a compact camera that I wouldn't get tired of carrying around all day on vacation trips. I'm also spoiled by the image quality of my DSLR so I needed something that could produce quality images I'd be happy to show my friends and family. This camera has not let me down. I also love the quality of the rear LCD display. It's bright and has pleasing color tones.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: What I love about the G10 are the features of an DSLR with a point & shoot camera. A friend of mine already got a couple of our friends to purchase the G10. Great camera for money!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Manual Control, Shoots RAW
Cons: Unreliable metering, Awful photos
I am a big fan of Canon. I have bought many Canon cameras for myself and my family. I had the previous model the Canon G9 which was excellent. The camera went kaput, and I replaced it with the newer G10. The new camera now has a wide angle lens but Canon cut back the zoom range on it. I did like the added telephoto on the G9 but the wide angle is more practical. The camera is slightly bigger than the G9 and some of the controls on top have been changed. When I first got the camera I was very happy with it but then the camera started underexposing shots and I lost some good ones. Maybe the camera was defective but I had read other reviews about this too. Even though I could go in and MAYBE tweak ... the exposure manually, why should I ? When I can use a much less expensive camera and get a beautifully exposed image I expect the same from a high end camera. The movie format was also changed from the G9 , supposedly better but I thought it was awful. I also have a Canon SD 770, 10 MP camera which blew the G10 out of the water. Now I am not trying to compare these two cameras as the G10 is so much more camera in terms of shooting RAW and complete manual control, etc. I took the camera back to Best Buy very disappointed with it. When it got the exposure right it was beautiful but when it didn' t I missed some good people shots that could not be done over. I shot with flash, no flash and every which way. I know my way around cameras. Although I shoot for pleasure, I am also a published photographer. Very disappointed ! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: The G10 is perfect for what I was looking for. More control than a basic point and shoot, but not as many bells and whistles - and smaller and cheaper - than a true SLR. The picture quality is fantastic. The response time is also very good. Unless I have the red-eye reduction on, or quick repetitive flash required shots, there is very little time lag. I have been taking lots of candid shots of kids, and that is always the trouble cause they tend to only be cute for a second or two. The various scene options and the built in editing were also a great surprise. I did not buy the camera for these features, but found myself playing with the options and very happy with how quick and easy it was to do, especially trimming and fixing red eye. Another feature is that this camera feels like a came ... ra. Has a solid construction, good grip, and just enough heft to it to feel stable. The camera wasn't cheap, but I definitely feel I got the features I paid for, and still several hundred cheaper than an SLR. Very Happy. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Great camera and functionality. Has easy point and shoot with great picture quality but also has all the features you would expect from a nice SLR.
Cons: Haven't found any.
Worth the money and I would buy this camera over an SLR.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: If you are looking for a powerful point and shoot - get the G10. Great exposure and color balance. the two complains I have are - No raw on full auto? and the lens is dog slow 2.7 max I was out on a windy day by the water at dusk and I would not get one clear exposure. But if you are familiar with Canon point and shoots - you will not even need to crack the manual - come to think of it - perhaps I should.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: I use this camera as a backup to my Digital SLR's, With the wider lens I photograph interiors and architecture. The self timer gives you 3 exposures and catches your subjects in great expressions. Easy to carry. Good in low light situations,i.e. the museum. Always purchase another battery! For being 1/3 the cost of a D-SLR the performance and image quality are great.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Good things come in small packages
Item.Review: Love the easy to use picture modes. Twice the megapixels than anybody needs besides a professional. Battery life is great. Great macro and wide angle shots with outstanding resolution. The color and saturation from this camera is what I've come to expect from Canon and it beats all the other competitors. I like to shoot in RAW mode and this camera does that.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: G10 Like Leica IIIC 60 Years Later
Item.Review: This is a great camera. Image quality is first rate and it handles like my leica of decades ago. Inobtrusive and quick, it handles candid photography with ease, but the LCD facilitates careful composition for my macro, scenic and archetectural work. Being sealed means no dust problems and less time in Photoshop. There are only two things I would change. The zoom control is too fast(!) and should restart at the last used setting. If that were fixed and the optical finder showed just a bit more of the frame, it would be perfect. I love it.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: got this cam to back up my DSLR. It is small enough and the image quality is good. I haven't printed any images yet but feel certain they will be up to par with the canon line. not a pro camera but I knew that going in

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Permit a loose analogy that illustrates the outcome when a company has a good basic design that is iteratively refined over the years. The VW was notable for great design and reliability; such is the case with the Canon G series. Almost intuitive to use, it makes photography fun again. With the G10 you have more control than you ever thought possible, and the basics are only a dial turn away. I purchased the camera as a compact alternative to my DSLR to accompany me on an overseas business trip. It's a lot of camera for the money!

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review: Pros: Durable, High Quality A great second camera if you own a digital SLR and like using software to adjust before printing. It is far more portable and the quality is excellent. I have taken night shots and find it easy to reduce the noise with Photoshop. The hot shoe for an external flash is super since all small, in-camera flashes are extremely weak

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Use
I bought this for my wife's Canon G10 and it functions well as a backup to her Canon battery. It doesn't seem to hold a charge quite as long as the Canon battery. Good addition to the camera bag though.

Item.Item: Canon PowerShot G10 14.7 MP Digital Camera
Item.ReviewTitle: Would return this, if i could.
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, looks great out doors
Cons: Quality, price, short battery life
I would not recommend this product. You have to steady the camera on like a ledge or something, set it to the 10 second mode 'till it takes a pic, and stand VERY still in order for it to just come out fairly decent. Other then that, even if you hold it and take a picture, it comes out horribly blurry. In doors, it makes the picture come out orange, and very odd looking. The only setting that makes the picture come out the clearest, is "flurescent", but unfortunetly that's also the most orange looking setting. And on top of it, for how much this product cost, you don't get your money's worth at all. Don't buy it.
Item.HelpfulCount: 0 out of 1 found this review helpful.
